data.question: What are the two rhodizonate transition-metal complexes reported in the study?
What role do rhodizonate and 2,2’-bipyrimidine (bpym) play in the complexes?
data.answer: They act as the bis-bidentate ligands to chelate the metal ions.

data.question: What is the molecular symmetry of rhodizonate in the complexes?
What is the yield of [Cd(C6O6)(bpym)(H2O)]·H2O when synthesized?
What is the yield of [Mn(C6O6)(bpym)(H2O)]·2 H2O when synthesized?
What is the geometric environment of the cadmium center in compound 1?
What is the significance of the nonplanar molecular geometry in C6O6^2-?
data.answer: It indicates less extensive p-electron delocalization in the six-membered ring of the dianion.

data.question: How does the molecular structure of compound 2 compare to that of compound 1?
data.answer: Almost the same, with a 2D chairlike {Mn6} MOF constructed through similar linkages.

data.question: What is the result of the absorption band measurement for compound 1 in DMSO?
data.answer: An absorption band maximized at 490 nm.

data.question: What emission band maximum does compound 1 exhibit upon excitation?
What is the purpose of examining the correlation between molecular symmetry and p-electron delocalization?
data.answer: To understand the diketone character and the molecular geometry of rhodizonate when used as a coordinating ligand.

data.question: What does the presence of a bis-bidentate (m4) binding mode of rhodizonate in the complexes indicate?
data.answer: It is a novel finding that contributes to understanding the coordination behavior of rhodizonate.

data.question: Is the molecular structure of rhodizonate in the complexes planar?
Is the yield of [Cd(C6O6)(bpym)(H2O)]·H2O higher than [Mn(C6O6)(bpym)(H2O)]·2 H2O?
Does the geometric environment of the manganese center in compound 2 differ significantly from that of the cadmium center in compound 1?
Are the Cd···Cd separations through C6O6^2- and bpym bridges identical in length?
Is the crystal structure of a rhodizonate transition-metal complex previously reported before this study?
Does the nonplanar molecular geometry of C6O6^2- suggest a high degree of p-electron delocalization?
Is the absorption band of compound 1 in DMSO maximized at 590 nm?
